x_symbol.description: Creates a collapsible list from nested ULs or nested DIVs. A UL/DIV is a "target" - it will have its display toggled when its "trigger" is clicked (except for the outermost UL/DIV). For ULs the trigger is the UL's previous sibling element. For DIVs the trigger is also the DIV's previous sibling element, but it must be a heading element (H1, H2, etc.).

par.name: outerEle
par.note: the id string (or object reference) of the outermost UL/DIV

par.name: bShow
par.note: if true, all targets are displayed initially

meth.name: displayAll
meth.note: set the display of all targets

meth.name: onUnload
meth.note: mainly for IE, removes circular references

comment.author: mf
mf
comment.note: The unload listener is because of IE's circular reference memory leak bug. You have to test for the existence of everything because of Opera's back button feature (which I like). I get around this by only unloading for IE.

comment.author: mf
comment.note: Note that Opera (currently using 7.54u2) will issue a window.onunload event for this: location.href = '#topofpg'
